com.st.BlueSTSDK.Features

Class FeatureAccelerationEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.BlueSTSDK.Feature
      • com.st.BlueSTSDK.Features.FeatureAccelerationEvent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FeatureRandomAccelerationEvent

    public class FeatureAccelerationEvent
extends Feature
    Feature that will contain the different event that can be discovered using an accelerometer data. The events can be generated by different algorithms that must be enabled using the function detectEvent(DetectableEvent, boolean). When an algorithm is enable the user can receive a notification thought the FeatureAccelerationEvent.FeatureAccelerationEventListener.onDetectableEventChange(com.st.BlueSTSDK.Features.FeatureAccelerationEvent, com.st.BlueSTSDK.Features.FeatureAccelerationEvent.DetectableEvent, boolean) function.

    When the pedometer is enabled the you can use getPedometerSteps(com.st.BlueSTSDK.Feature.Sample) for retrieve the number of steps. Otherwise the function will return a negative number

      • extractData

        protected Feature.ExtractResult extractData(long timestamp,
                                            @NonNull
                                            byte[] data,
                                            int dataOffset)
        read a byte with the event data send from the node
        Specified by:
        extractData in class Feature
        Parameters:
        timestamp - data timestamp
        data - array where read the data
        dataOffset - offset where start to read the data
        Returns:
        number of read byte (1) and data extracted (the Activity id)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the data array has not enough data 3 bytes: acc event + #steps 2 bytes: #steps or acc Event

      • detectEvent

        public boolean detectEvent(FeatureAccelerationEvent.DetectableEvent event,
                           boolean enable)
        start looking for an event type
        Parameters:
        event - algorithm to enable/disable
        enable - true for enable it, false for disable it
        Returns:
        true if the command is correctly send or the algorithm is already enabled

        Only one algorithm can run at time, enabling an algorithm will disable the previous one.

      • getEnabledEvent

        @Nullable
public FeatureAccelerationEvent.DetectableEvent getEnabledEvent()
        Returns:
